file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-23-21-04 - FUELING/DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FUELING/DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the fueling/defueling adapter cap. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FUELING/DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP - ALL 28-23-21-000-801-A REMOVAL FUELING/DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP - ALL 28-23-21-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-23-21 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-23-21-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FUELING/DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the fueling/defueling adapter cap. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191BR Forward wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward wing-to-fuselage fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) Open access panel 191BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the fueling/ defueling adapter cap. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Push and turn the fueling/defueling adapter cap (3) counterclockwise to remove it. (2) Push the clip (1) from the ring (4) to remove the cable (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-23-21 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the fueling/defueling adapter cap (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-23-21 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Fueling/Defueling Adapter Cap - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 191 B FORWARD WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING (REF.) DET. A 1. CLIP 4. RING 3. FUELING/ DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP 2. CABLE DET. B 145AMM280927.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-23-21 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-23-21-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FUELING/DEFUELING ADAPTER CAP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the fueling/defueling adapter cap. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191BR Forward wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward wing-to-fuselage fairing I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) Put the fueling/defueling adapter cap (3) in position. (2) Install the clip (1) on the ring (4). (3) Push and turn the fueling/defueling adapter cap (3) clockwise to attach it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-23-21 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Close access panel 191BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-23-21 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
